required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Psychomotor Development and Attachment in Children Aged 6 to 30 Months With Oral Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Psychomotor Development and Attachment in Children Aged 6 to 30 Months With Oral Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: Dietary difficulties and eating disorders of the child are a common reason for consulting infants and young children. There is currently little data on the psychomotor development of these children and their association with parent-child attachment. The objective of this study is to evaluate, at the same time, the three physiological, psychomotor and attachment dimensions of children with eating disorders.

primary_outcome.description: Developmental Quotient at Brunet Lézine revised

secondary_outcome.measure: Quotient of development of the posturo-motor skills
secondary_outcome.description: Quotient of development of the posturo-motor subcategory with revised Brunet Lézine

secondary_outcome.measure: Development Quotient for the Brunet Lézine Coordination Subcategory
secondary_outcome.description: Development Quotient for the Brunet Lézine Coordination Subcategory

secondary_outcome.measure: Developmental Quotient for Brunet Lézine Language Subcategory
secondary_outcome.description: Developmental Quotient for Brunet Lézine Language Subcategory

secondary_outcome.measure: Development Quotient for the Brunet Lézine Socialization Subcategory
secondary_outcome.description: Development Quotient for the Brunet Lézine Socialization Subcategory
Rating on the evaluation grid with tactile irritability
Score at the grid observation of attachment lines before, during and after the separation of the child
Terms of Description of Grandparent / Parent and Parent / Child Attachment by Qualitative Analysis to Semi-directed Issues on Attachment

secondary_outcome.measure: Food difficulty score child eating behavior questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Food difficulty score child eating behavior questionnaire

arm_group.description: Children in the study aged 6 to 30 months followed or referred to CHIC for oral disorders will have a psychomotor assessment and a psychological interview. Questionnaires on eating behavior will also be proposed.

study_pop.textblock: children aged from 6 to 30 months with eating disorder and adressed by the pediatrician or general practitionner

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age: 6 to 30 months
- Oral disorder defined by a MCH score ≥ 61
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children in enteral nutrition asked for an indication other than oral disorders
- Children followed for serious chronic organic pathology causing disorders of the oral (DNTC, swallowing disorders, etc.)
- Child already assessed by the psychomotrician who participated in the study
- Placement of the child in a medical institution or in a foster family.
- Parents' refusal to participate in the study
- Establishment of a psychomotor follow-up between the time of the medical consultation and the psychomotor evaluation.
